#summary Probatron4J makes a number of custom XPath extension functions available.

= XPath Extension Functions =

Probatron4J makes a number of custom XPath extension functions available.

These functions are in the Namespace "`http://www.probatron.org/functions`", which must be bound and used when using these functions. In this documentation the prefix "pr" is assumed to be so bound.

For example:

{{{
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<sch:schema xmlns:sch="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"
  xmlns:pr="http://www.probatron.org/functions">

 <!-- we bind the 'pr' prefix for use in function calls -->
 <sch:ns prefix="pr" uri="http://www.probatron.org/functions"/>

 <sch:pattern>
    <sch:rule id="isbn-test" flag="warn" context="isbn">
      <!-- using an extension function here -->
      <sch:assert test="pr:is-valid-isbn(.)">Not an ISBN</sch:assert>
    </sch:rule>
  </sch:pattern>

</sch:schema>

}}}


= Details =

== is-valid-isbn ==

`pr:is-valid-isbn($arg as xs:string) as xs:boolean`

Returns `true` if `$arg` is a lexically valid 10 digit ISBN with a valid checksum digit; otherwise returns `false`.


== is-valid-isbn-13 ==

`pr:is-valid-isbn-13($arg as xs:string) as xs:boolean`

Returns `true` if `$arg` is a lexically valid 13 digit ISBN with a valid checksum digit; otherwise returns `false`.


== is-valid-issn ==

`pr:is-valid-issn($arg as xs:string) as xs:boolean`

Returns `true` if `$arg` is a lexically valid ISSN with a valid checksum digit; otherwise returns `false`.
